result.execSummary:
The defendant Ciara Jo Lessard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant, Ciara Jo Lessard did not appear at motion hearing.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court denied motion.

Order to revoke Huber privileges and loss of transfer to La Crosse County, must serve jail in Columbia County due to jail violations.

filed by attorney Anthony C. Delyea

Defendant Ciara Jo Lessard in court with attorney Anthony C. Delyea.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over.  Information filed, reading waived.  Rights/Elements.  Defendant pled guilty.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Court withheld sentencing, placed defendant on probation for 1 year and 6 months.  Conditions of probation include: $518.00 costs.  30 days jail.  AODA and comply.  Submit DNA sample.  May transfer jail time to LaCrosse County.  Jail to be determined by agent, must start within the first 4 months of probation. 6 month periodic review.

Defendant Ciara Jo Lessard in court with attorney Anthony C. Delyea.  Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Reset requested to get test results from the State. Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 16, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant, Ciara Jo Lessard, appeared. Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant would like an atty.  State had no objection.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 03:00 pm.  Return date scheduled for October 1, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
